page.title: 05LIFESTYLE WICKLEWOOD THEN
page.content: My grandfather went to live in Wicklewood when he was two years old, in 1907, and lived in a thatched cottage. In 1912 there was a bad flood and a boy and several cows were drowned.The first motor in the village was a privately owned bus and it provided the first service. There were four public houses called The Wild Man, Kimberley Arms, Brickmakers' Arms and the Cherry Tree. Only the last remains. The mill was worked by a father and two sons and the miller could be seen milling at night in his nightgown if the wind was strong! During the First World War a British plane crashed in a cornfield and a bomb landed near St. George's School. There were two brothers who made top quality boots,a baker, butcher,blacksmith and a carpenter. There was a post office in High Street
